III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff.
Description (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth entered the room of another youth and sexually assaulted
the youth. The victim youth fears for their life and the perpetrating
youth continues to harass the other youth and make ongoing
threats.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was contacted via phone on 7/21/2025.
Complainant did not provide any additional information.
Youth A was forensically interviewed at the child advocacy center
on 8/27/2025. Youth A reported somebody touched him wrong
while at the facility. Youth A reported laying in his room when
someone ran in and tried to touch him. Youth A identified Youth B
touched him. Youth A reported Youth B attempted to touch his
behind. Youth A reported Youth B grabbed his penis and
squeezed for a second and then Youth A was able to get away
from him. Youth A reported Youth B would say things to him such
as he liked how his lips looked. Youth A could not recall what else
was said. Youth A reported telling Youth B to get away from him.
Youth A said the touching occurred one time. Youth A could not
recall which or if any staff were nearby. Youth A could not recall if
any other residents were nearby. Youth A reported a staff came
into the room and helped him get away. Youth A could not
elaborate how the staff assisted or describe the staff. Youth A was
not able to provide details on time of day or how long ago the
incident occurred.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at his placement on
9/15/2025. Youth B denied saying anything inappropriate such as
“I like your lips, I can tell your penis is big, or I want to date you” to
Youth A or to any other youth while placed in the facility. Youth B
denied touching Youth A’s behind or penis at any time while at the
facility. Youth B denied being in Youth A’s bedroom with him at
any time.
Manager 1, Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, Manager 2, Youth D,
and Youth E were all interviewed face to face at the facility on
2

9/18/2025. Each denied hearing or being aware of Youth B
making any sexually inappropriate comments to Youth A including
liking him, wanting to date him, liking his lips, or anything
regarding his private parts. Each denied observing or hearing
about Youth B touching Youth A’s behind or penis. Each denied
witnessing or hearing about Youth B being in Youth A’s room with
him at any time.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report 072522602 dated 7/18/2025 authored by
complainant states centralized intake was contacted due to
disclosure of sexual abuse. No other incident report related
to this incident exists.
• Behavior Observation Forms for Youth B document
behavioral concerns unrelated to sexual harassment or
abuse.
• Youth Movement and Supervision Policy states if there is a
disturbance or situation requiring intervention while
residents are in the bedrooms, a minimum of 2 staff with
one being a supervisor, must be present to unlock and
enter the room.
Video Review:
There is no video footage available.
Analysis There is not enough information to indicate a rule violation
established regarding this allegation. There were no reports of
observing Youth B making sexually advances towards Youth A
including making statements or touching him. Youth A could not
provide details about when this happened or who else was around
so there is no documentation or video footage of any incidents
related to the allegation.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Manager 1 mistreats youth by taking things such as TV time and
snacks for no reason, will put youth who do not like each other on
the same pod so they will fight, and say things like “this is my
pod.”
3

Investigation Interviews:
Youth A was forensically interviewed at the child advocacy center
on 8/27/2025. Youth A reported Manager 1 will say things to youth
such as “this is my pod.” Youth A reported Manager 1 will take TV
time and snacks from youth. Youth A reported Manager 1 will put
youth together who do not get along on the same pod on purpose
so they will fight.
Manager 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
9/18/2025. Manager 1 denied removing privileges including TV
time or snacks at any time from residents. Manager 1 denied
saying “this is my pod,” or any similar statements to residents.
Manager 1 denied purposefully placing youth who do not get
along together on pods so they will fight or trigger each other.
Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2, Manager 2, Youth B, Youth C,
Youth D, and Youth E were all interviewed face to face at the
facility on 9/18/2025. Each denied having any concerns with
Manager 1. Each denied Manager 1 saying “this is my pod,” or
any similar statements to youth. Each denied Manager 1 taking
TV time or snacks from youth. Each denied Manager 1
purposefully putting youth who do not get along together on
purpose to fight or trigger one another.
Documentation Review:
• Human Resources file for Manager 1 documents 49 hours
of training and 1 disciplinary report from 2/9/2023 regarding
unrelated concerns.
• Facility Code of Ethics states employees will not participate
in any activities that result in victimization of residents and
employees will provide guidance, direction and support to
residents with concern for his or her welfare.
Analysis There is no rule violation established regarding this allegation.
Interviews with staff and youth denied concerns with Manager 1
as further supported by the reviewed human resources file.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
